answers.answer: You should definitely talk to a doctor about that. I have heard that menstrual issues that people have had in the past can come out when taking the hcg. I don't know much about preeclampsia, other than it is dangerous, but if you had difficulties when you were pregnant, you MIGHT have difficulties while being on the hcg. However, the amount of hcg on the diet is so small, it might not  have any effect like that.

question: I want to try the HCG but I'm a little worried while I was pregnant with my first child I had preeclampsia (hopefully spelled that right). I was wondering if that would come into effect since this is a hormone that pregnant women have?
title: HCG injections
